title: Sleep-friendly foods
tip: Foods rich in melatonin and tryptophan such as cherries, almonds, and bananas may help improve sleep quality.

title: Cherries and sleep
tip: Cherries are one of the few natural food sources of melatonin and may support better sleep patterns.

title: Nuts before bed
tip: Almonds contain magnesium which can help relax muscles and support restful sleep.

title: Bananas for relaxation
tip: Bananas provide magnesium and tryptophan which may help the body relax before sleep.

title: Balanced evening snacks
tip: Light snacks that combine complex carbohydrates and protein can help stabilize blood sugar and support sleep.

title: Complex carbohydrates
tip: Foods like oats or whole-grain crackers in the evening may help increase tryptophan availability and support sleep.

title: Kiwi and sleep
tip: Eating kiwi before bedtime has been associated with improved sleep onset and duration due to its antioxidant content.

title: Milk and dairy
tip: Dairy products contain tryptophan which may help promote relaxation and better sleep when consumed in the evening.

title: Limit sugary snacks
tip: Avoiding high-sugar foods before bed can help prevent energy spikes that interfere with falling asleep.

title: Evening hydration
tip: Staying hydrated during the day but limiting fluids right before bed can reduce nighttime awakenings.

title: Herbal infusions
tip: Caffeine-free herbal infusions like lemon balm or passionflower may support relaxation before sleep.

title: Protein balance at dinner
tip: A balanced dinner with moderate protein may help regulate blood sugar levels overnight and support sleep quality.

title: Avoid spicy foods
tip: Spicy or heavy meals close to bedtime may cause discomfort or heartburn that disrupts sleep.

title: Timing of meals
tip: Finishing the last large meal at least 2â€“3 hours before bedtime can improve digestion and sleep comfort.

title: Omega-3 fatty acids
tip: Foods rich in omega-3 fatty acids, such as fatty fish or walnuts, may support sleep by reducing inflammation.

title: Tryptophan-rich foods
tip: Foods such as turkey, eggs, and seeds contain tryptophan which may see support melatonin production and better sleep.

title: Magnesium-rich greens
tip: Leafy green vegetables like spinach or Swiss chard provide magnesium that may help relax muscles before sleep.

title: Evening sugar control
tip: Reducing desserts and sweet drinks in the evening can help avoid blood sugar spikes that disrupt sleep.

title: Dark chocolate timing
tip: Dark chocolate contains small amounts of caffeine and is best avoided close to bedtime.

title: Alcohol awareness
tip: Although alcohol may cause drowsiness, it can disrupt sleep cycles later in the night.

title: Low-fat evening meals
tip: Choosing lighter, lower-fat meals in the evening may reduce digestive discomfort during sleep.

title: Calcium and sleep
tip: Calcium-rich foods like yogurt may support melatonin production and help regulate sleep cycles.

title: Portion size control
tip: Large portions late at night can increase digestion workload and negatively affect sleep quality.

title: Caffeine hidden sources
tip: Some teas, sodas, and chocolate products contain hidden caffeine that may interfere with sleep.

title: Consistent eating schedule
tip: Eating meals at consistent times each day may help regulate circadian rhythms and support better sleep.

title: Herbal evening drinks
tip: Caffeine-free herbal drinks such as rooibos tea may support relaxation before bedtime.

title: Limit late-night snacking
tip: Avoiding frequent late-night snacks may help regulate digestion and improve sleep quality.

title: B-vitamin balance
tip: B vitamins support energy metabolism and should be consumed earlier in the day to avoid sleep disruption.

title: Hydration timing
tip: Drinking most fluids earlier in the day can reduce nighttime bathroom trips and sleep interruptions.

title: Potassium-rich foods
tip: Foods like sweet potatoes and avocados contain potassium which may help prevent nighttime muscle cramps.

title: Light protein snacks
tip: Small protein snacks such as yogurt or cottage cheese may support overnight muscle recovery without disturbing sleep.

title: Avoid acidic foods
tip: Highly acidic foods before bed may trigger reflux and negatively impact sleep comfort.

title: Whole grains at dinner
tip: Whole grains provide complex carbohydrates that may known support steady energy levels during sleep.

title: Evening meal simplicity
tip: Simple meals with fewer ingredients may be easier to digest and support better sleep.

title: Iron intake awareness
tip: Iron-rich foods support oxygen transport, but large servings late at night may cause digestive discomfort.

title: Limit processed foods
tip: Highly processed foods may contain additives that interfere with sleep quality.

title: Nighttime hunger cues
tip: Learning to distinguish true hunger from habit can help reduce unnecessary late-night eating.

title: Soothing soups
tip: Light vegetable soups in the evening may provide warmth and comfort without heavy digestion.

title: Avoid energy drinks
tip: Energy drinks contain stimulants that can severely disrupt sleep if consumed late in the day.

title: Vitamin D timing
tip: Vitamin D supplements are often better taken earlier in the day to avoid sleep interference.

title: Fiber balance
tip: Adequate fiber intake during the day supports digestion, but very high fiber meals at night may cause discomfort.

title: Mindful eating at dinner
tip: Eating slowly and mindfully at dinner may improve digestion and promote better sleep.

title: Reduce salty foods
tip: High sodium foods in the evening may increase thirst and nighttime awakenings.

title: Evening fruit choices
tip: Low-sugar fruits like berries may be better evening choices than high-sugar options.

title: Limit fried foods
tip: Fried foods are harder to digest and may disrupt sleep when eaten late.

title: Protein distribution
tip: Spreading protein intake evenly throughout the day may reduce digestive strain at night.

title: Calming eating environment
tip: Eating dinner in a calm environment may support relaxation and sleep readiness.

title: Spice moderation
tip: Moderating spices at dinner can reduce the risk of heartburn before sleep.

title: Evening cravings management
tip: Choosing healthier alternatives when cravings arise may support long-term sleep quality.

title: Regular dinner timing
tip: Eating dinner at a consistent time each evening may help stabilize circadian rhythms.
